title: Job Vacancies at HR Hub Nigeria
content:
HRHub.ng Limited is a Human Resource Development & Management Consulting practice firm located in Lagos. Since its founding, HRHub.ng Ltd has grown to become a leader in the provision of high value human resources, business advisory as well as learning & development solutions to multinationals, local corporate organizations, governments and multilateral organizations. Our depth of our expertise, defined by carefully selected pool of multi-disciplinary consultants, ensures that we continue to be the firm of choice to our growing list of discerning clienteles.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Representative
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking proactive and results-driven Sales Representatives to promote and sell our range of real estate offerings (houses and land) to both new and existing clients.
	The ideal candidates will possess strong communication skills, a professional appearance, and a passion for achieving sales targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell properties to new and existing customers.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships.
	Identify sales leads and convert them into successful deals.
	Meet or exceed assigned sales targets.
	Provide excellent customer service and follow-up.
	Represent the brand professionally at all times.
	Travel occasionally to client sites and property locations.


Requirements


	Minimum of a university degree.
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to drive (a valid driver’s license is an added advantage).
	Good dress sense and professional appearance.
	Hardworking, loyal, and result-oriented.
	Self-driven and highly motivated.
	Resides close to the office (Lekki axis preferred).
	Prior experience in real estate sales is an added advantage.


Salary
N120,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 21st November, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@hrhub.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Chief Operating Officer (COO) to lead our operations, strengthen creative production workflows, drive marketing initiatives, and manage key partnerships.
	The ideal candidate will ensure smooth delivery of high-quality content and operational excellence across all units.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee day-to-day operations across productions, events, and media projects.
	Lead content development and ensure high-quality storytelling.
	Manage planning, budgeting, logistics, vendors, and talent.
	Supervise production teams and freelancers.
	Execute marketing, PR, and digital growth strategies.
	Build and maintain client, sponsor, and partner relationships.
	Represent the company in meetings and negotiations.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Journalism, Media Studies, or related fields
	Proven media, content creation, or operations management experience.
	Strong leadership, communication, and storytelling skills.
	Demonstrated ability to manage people and complex projects.


Application Closing Date: 18th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@hrhub.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Ubuntu Software Engineer Job at Canonical Nigeria




        
    

        
        
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Canonical - We deliver open source to the world faster, more securely, and more cost-effectively than any other company. We develop Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means 'humanity to others. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation. Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers. Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why it's the fastest-growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Ubuntu Software Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

The Role Entails
Based on the first round of interviews, we identify specific teams where you might be an excellent fit and conduct second-round interviews with those teams. Our engineers are:


	Designing, building and shipping software in Rust, Go and Python
	Packaging, integrating, testing and uploading open source software to the Ubuntu repositories
	Debugging system-level issues and delivering robust solutions
	Authoring and improving technical and community documentation
	Contributing to upstream and neighboring open source projects
	Collaborating as part of a globally distributed team
	Mentoring their colleagues to build skills and understanding
	Developing and improving processes to more efficiently fulfill our goals


What we are looking for in you


	An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
	Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
	Drive and a track record of going above and beyond expectations
	A demonstrated passion for open source software
	Significant experience with Rust, Go, Python, Flutter or C/C++
	Professional written and spoken English
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


Nice-to-have skills:


	Experience with Linux distributions and distribution engineering
	Experience with software packaging and distribution mechanisms
	Understanding of build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation 
	Performance or Security Engineering

Restaurant General Manager Job at Skyline International Tourism & Hospitality Limited




        
    

        
        Skyline International Tourism and Hospitality Limited (SITH) was established in 2019 as the hospitality division of the Skyline Group in Nigeria. SITH is the franchisee for Pizza Hut in Nigeria (all regions except Lagos). Pizza Hut is part of Yum Brands (formerly PepsiCo Restaurants). Skyline International Tourism and Hospitality is the fastest growing F&B company in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant General Manager
Job Location: Lugbe, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities

	Operations: Oversee all daily activities, from opening to closing, ensuring smooth workflow.
	Staff Management: Recruit, train, schedule, supervise, and motivate employees; resolve conflicts.
	Customer Service: Greet guests, handle inquiries, manage complaints, and build rapport to ensure satisfaction.
	Financial Management: Manage budgets, track sales, control costs, minimize expenses, and report performance.
	Inventory & Supplies: Monitor stock levels, order supplies, manage vendors, and control waste.
	Compliance: Enforce health, safety, sanitation, and company policies (e.g., cash handling).
	Marketing: Implement promotional strategies to attract and retain customers.


Typical Duties Include:


	Creating staff rotas.
	Designing menus (sometimes).
	Ensuring food quality and presentation.
	Reporting to upper management.


Essential Skills & Qualifications


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Proven management / leadership experience.
	Strong financial acumen and business knowledge.
	Excellent communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrd@sithltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Candidates must reside in Lugbe.
